Class InventoryOrderingController

java.lang.Object
ui.Controller
ui.InventoryOrderingController
public class InventoryOrderingController extends Controller
The InventoryOrderingController Class controls the inventory ordering page, including the inventory item description table and the table that stores items for an in progress order
Since:
2024-10-18

  • Method Details

    • initialize

      public void initialize()
      This is the initialize method which sets up the page when it is loaded, filling the inventory item table from the database
      Throws:
      Exception - Throws a variety of exceptions related to accessing the database.

    • BackButtonPressed

      public void BackButtonPressed(javafx.event.ActionEvent e)
      This is the BackButtonPressed method which allows the back button to return to the manager screen
      Parameters:
      e - unused.

    • showDescriptionPopup

      public void showDescriptionPopup(Integer itemCode, String description, Double unitCost)
      This is the showDescriptionPopup method which creates a popup screen to add an item to the inventory order when the order button is pressed
      Parameters:
      itemCode - the itemCode of the item being added.
      description - the description of the item being added.
      unitCost - the unit cost of the item being added.

    • RemoveRow

      public void RemoveRow(InProgressOrderItem item)
      This is the RemoveRow method which removes an item from the in progress table when the remove button is pressed
      Parameters:
      item - the item being removed.

    • RestockButton

      public void RestockButton()
      This is the RestockButton method which creates a popup screen displaying the items in need of restocking
      Throws:
      Exception - Throws a variety of exceptions related to loading a new scene.

    • createRestockOrder

      public void createRestockOrder()
      This is the createRestockOrder method which adds all items that need to be restocked to an inventory order

    • finishOrder

      public void finishOrder(javafx.event.ActionEvent e)
      This is the finishOrder method which finalizes the inventory order and updates the inventory_orders and inventory tables in the database
      Parameters:
      e - unused.
      Throws:
      Exception - Throws a variety of exceptions related to accessing the database.
